dt: {bc}to consider and appraise usually from a particular point of view
{bc}to pay attention to {bc}take into consideration or account

pt: {sc}regard{/sc} {sc}respect{/sc} {sc}esteem{/sc} {sc}admire{/sc} mean to recognize the worth of a person or thing. {sc}regard{/sc} is a general term that is usually qualified.

pt.t: he is highly {it}regarded{/it} in the profession

pt: {sc}respect{/sc} implies a considered evaluation or estimation.

pt.t: after many years they came to {it}respect{/it} her views

pt: {sc}esteem{/sc} implies greater warmth of feeling accompanying a high valuation.

pt.t: no citizen of the town was more highly {it}esteemed{/it}

pt: {sc}admire{/sc} suggests usually enthusiastic appreciation and often deep affection.

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}regarder{/it} to look back at, regard, from {it}re-{/it} + {it}garder{/it} to guard, look at {ma}{mat|guard|}{/ma}
shortdef: to consider and appraise usually from a particular point of view
to pay attention to : take into consideration or account

dt: {bc}concerned with oneself or one's own interests

shortdef: concerned with oneself or one's own interests
